Ping Nalongsone Danddank

ABOUT

CONTACT

Objective

Hi, I'm Ping. I'm looking for An job's opportunity in Software Engineer or Website Developer at Enter or Junior Level that could allow me to earn experience and utilize my Problem-Solving Skills, Creative Ability and attention to detail to further develop my abilities working in the field of IT, Software Engineer and Data Science.

Accomplishments in Self-teaching

· HTML5, CSS3/Sass, Bootstrap: These web design technologies that I used in client side and my Portfolio websie to show my works. I also used popular API like Swiper, Particles, etc to make better responsive and backgroud on the website. Adobe Xd, Photoshop & Illustrator tool are in my designing web page too.

· Javascript: I have understood the principles of OOP in Java and functional programming in Python, so that when I learn and practice JS ES5 & ES6, It is more comfortable and learn quickly for me. Even thought, the new concept of JS like Call-back function, Promise, and Asynchronous is new for me, but I think it is so powerful and useful for the single-threaded.

· Client-Side: I chose React & Redux of JS library to build a single page website and work with API REST Client, for my practice in my first project in front-end development. I think it is the best choice and powerful to learn and understand the single page and the workflows of the front-end development. And using with Webpack for Module Loader and Bundler is quit easy manage in the large and complicated project. Another JS frameworks like AngularJS and Vue.js, I have learned and build some project to compare for the best choice for Client-Side.

· Server-Side: I think using Javascript on both Client-Side and Server-Side is more convenient and easy to control than using another language in the Web Server. So, Node.js or Express.js like middleware to handle the stack of http request, are my favorite choice to use to build my APP and deploy to API, REST server. For the packet management I think using NPM is enough for me. I may learn more about PHP if the team request.

· Database: SQL is the first language that I used to handle objects in the database. I practice MySQL for understanding the basic of SQL. However, I focused on NoSQL like MongoDB or Mongoose that use with NodeJs and NPM is my pratrice for my side project that let me get more understand about database.

· Data Visualization: SVG/D3.js is my beginning to practice to show, formate, and visualize the data from API or another. It looks better and works well with React too.

· Testing: Jest and Mocha are my first choice to use for my practice and learning for testing my Javascript codes.

· Python: It’s powerful, high efficiency and useful language in nowadays and the future. I learned it because I am interested in AI, Data science and new technology. So, I plan to learn Machine Learning and Deep Learning to prepare for AI in my future’s career. In addition, Python's Framework like Django (Synchronous) and Aiohttp (Asynchronous) is very popular and powerful in the server side.

Accomplishments in College Courses

· Java: I was deeper understood Object-Oriented Programming or OOP by Java like Polymorphism, Abstraction, Encapsulation, Inheritance, synchronous and multiple threaded programming. That lets me understand how important OOP in the real world. I practiced OOP by using Java 8 and swing framework in Eclipse build the GUI for implement my class's assignment and side projects. I have learned Java Unit for testing my source Programming. Then, Java web framework like Spring and Java EE is my next purpost to learn and practice.

· C/C++: the first programming language I have learned for Programming Fundamentals course. C programming language lets me understand the basic of CPU and memory work inside the computer, and how to handle the memory address, pointer, etc. C++ lets me enter to OOP and understand about data structure & algorithms.

· Data structure & Algorithms: In my class, I was taught by using Java to implement them like LinkedList, Stack, Tree, Maps, sort, merger sort, etc. I also learn another language like Javascript, Python and C/C++ to diversity and enhance my skill in Data structure and Algorithms. I found lots of examples of data structure & algorithms in books and online for practicing solving problem skills.

· Basic of Computer Organization and Architecture: This course let me learn the fundamental of programming language, Machine Language. How the hardware like CPU and Memory work and implement with the logical of systems and software in the real world. MIPS Assembly Language is this course that I learn to implement some Arithmetic, Memory Access, Branches, Decisions, and Loops, etc. That let me get more confident in the basic process of computer architecture.

· Discrete & Statistics Mathematic: I like to learn and solve math problems since I was kid. when I succeed solving math questions I enjoy it like enjoy music and movie. · Architect's tools: when I work as achitect, I have an experience working with AutoCAD, Revit software, Rhino3d, GH, 3Dsmax, Vray, Sketchup, etc.

EDUCATION

| JUNE 2019 | ASSOCIATE | COMPUTER SCIENCE | CENTURY COLLEGE | MINNESOTA USA |

I have gotten GPA: 3.82 in CS Courses, Math and Science courses all grade A (Fall 2017 - SPRING 2019).

| JUNE 2010 | BACHELOR | ARCHITECTURE | SOUTH CHINA UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY | GUANGZHOU CHINA |

After I finish this major, I have worked as Achitect in china from Fall 2010 to Fall 2015) before I came to the U.S.

BIO

I was born in Laos, a small country and beautiful locates in southeastern Asia, and my second language is Chinese. In 2004, I studied first year in Lao university, I got a full Chinese Scholarship by exam, and went to study undergraduate in Architecture major in China university. After finishing bachelor degree and working as architect in China about 12 years, I decided to look for a new opportunity to explore the new experience for my life. In beginning, I came here for study English to improve my thirst language. Now I am an international student at Century College for computer science major. I really like to study in the U.S, especially in Minnesota’s Environment and living cost which allow me to live and study here. So, I plan to finish my four years bachelor degree with my favorite major. I think this major could provide many job’s opportunities and improve my life and family to be better in the future.
